overview:
Micki Krimmel is the founder of Favortree, the first ever mobile Play it Forward favor-trading game. Members earn rewards for doing favors for people in their community and can trade for favors when they need help.

Micki previously founded NeighborGoods.net, a pioneer of Collaborative Consumption.

She is also the co-founder of a shared workspace located in the Arts District in downtown LA called The Idyllic Nerd Commune and the co-founder of LA Startup Club.

Micki has been building online communities for a decade. In addition to working for multiple startups, she created Participant Media’s first online community and led the social media efforts for Al Gore’s An Inconvenient Truth, one of the highest grossing documentaries of all time.

In her spare time, Micki plays roller derby with LA Derby Dolls’ all star team.
